metadata.Title: CVE-2020-24606 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Squid before 4.13 and 5.x before 5.0.4 allows a trusted peer to perform Denial of Service by consuming all available CPU cycles during handling of a crafted Cache Digest response message. This only occurs when cache_peer is used with the cache digests feature. The problem exists because peerDigestHandleReply() livelocking in peer_digest.cc mishandles EOF.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24606` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.15
squid-cgi - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.15
squid-common - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.15
squid-purge - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.15
squid3 - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.15
squidclient - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.15
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: squid3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.12-1ubuntu7.15').
